job_description:
12 months contract

Hybrid Role(Greenwood Village, CO)

Wednesday everyone in and can’t take Monday and Friday as a pair to take Hybrid

Top Skills:

Python

JavaScript

React

Django

Job Summary

Responsible for assisting design, development, and implementation of enterprise-wide customer premises equipment (CPE) activation, provisioning, and operations tools and automation platforms applications and their associated operating systems and databases. Participation in full life-cycle of systems engineering activities of high-quality, scalable solutions.

Major Duties And Responsibilities
• Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience
• Develops tools and applications to increase automation of manual process to increase accuracy and efficiency in day-to-day tasks
• Develops tools to aid in proactive monitoring and issue detection on customer premises equipment and the associated back office systems
• Coordinates with internal departments to review existing integration capabilities, data sources, and proposed solution designs for feasibility, cost and functionality
• Conducts design sessions with appropriate participation from architects and engineers
• Creates detailed design documents and functional specifications for new applications / services and for enhancements to existing systems / services
• Collaborates to creates configuration designs for design and implementation of various environments
• Creates work effort estimates for new features and bug fixes for use in prioritization and release management
• Design core code modules, unit test tools and release notes for enhancements and bug fixes
• Reviews new development tools, application frameworks and testing tools for functionality / effectiveness
• Provides on call support to resolve application and tool outages after normal business hours
• Uses established change management processes, requiring operational procedures be performed with minimal customer impact, (i.e. during established maintenance window)
• Configure, tune and maintain databases in variety of languages
• Documents systems configurations and upgrades
• Designs and implements change and control policies and disaster recovery plans; lead troubleshooting efforts to restore functionality in the event of an outage
• Monitors and assists in managing applications, device availability, network conditions and status, system reliability and performance, service and program maintenance and storage resources
• Perform other duties as requested by supervisor

Required Qualifications

Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
• Working knowledge of UNIX-based platforms
• Experience with Problem Solving/Troubleshooting Techniques
• Experience with troubleshooting tools (i.e tcpdump, netstat, iostat, traceroute, snoop)
• Working knowledge with System monitoring applications (OP5, Nagios, Solarwinds, HP OpenView, etc).
• Working knowledge of LAN/WAN topology, network protocols (TCP/IP, FTP, NFS), switches and firewalls
• Experience activating/maintaining CPE per the DOCSIS, PacketCable, and SNMP specifications
• Experience with configuration of CPE using the TR-069 and related specifications
• Experience with DHCP, DNS, SNMP, and TFTP protocols
• Ability to read, write and speak the English language to communicate with employees, customers, suppliers, in person, on the phone, and by written communications in a clear, straight-forward, and professional manner
• Advanced ability to conduct design sessions to specify solution designs for feasibility, cost, and functionality
• Advanced ability to create detailed documentation to functionally understand new and existing applications
• Advanced ability to follow and implement established change and control policies and procedures
• Advanced ability to troubleshoot application problems
• In-depth knowledge of development tools, application frameworks, and testing tools.
• In-depth knowledge of OSS applications and software
• In-depth knowledge of choosing the appropriate lifecycle and the planning, monitoring and control of the systems engineering process
• Strong ability to transform an operational need into a description of system parameters and incorporate those parameters in the control of the total system development to achieve an optimum, cost-effective balance of all system elements
• Advanced knowledge of the Python programing language including utilization of Class Structures, network related modules and programing (HTTP, socket, ping, snmp, etc ), database integration, Python web frameworks, RESTful API integration
• Strong with Object Oriented Programming along with applicable design patterns
• Advanced ability to develope REST APIs
• In-depth knowledge in relational databases(MySQL / MariaDB, Postgres, etc.) and SQL syntax
• In-depth knowledge of Source/Version Control (Git, GitHub, GitLab, BitBucket) and performing pull/merge requests along with code reviews
• In-depth experience in developing CI/CD pipelines(Jenkins, GitLab Runner, Atlassian Bamboo)
• Experience using Atlassian JIRA or similar software with Agile / Kanban boards to manage tasks. Experience with Maintaining Documentation via Confluence
• In-depth knowling working with message brokers such as Redis, RabbitMQ, or Apache Kafka
• Experience with containerization engines such as Docker
• Experience with WebSocket(real-time streaming over HTTP)
• Experience with Automated Testing Frameworks.

Key Platforms / Systems / Disciplines
• RHEL 6/7, CentOS 6/7
• MySQL, Postgress
• Redis, RabbitMQ, or Apache Kafka
• Git, GitHub, GitLab, BitBucket
• MySQL / MariaDB, Postgres
• Jenkins, GitLab Runner, Atlassian Bamboo
• AWS / S3 / Lambda Functions / Athena / DynamoDB / Cloudwatch
• Python, Javascript/Typescript, Bash, Pearl, C/C++, Java, LUA, PHP

job_title: React & React Native Frontend Developer - Remote
job_description:
TL;DR

Our client is building an MVP application to help organize, prioritize, and align daily tasks to be connected to long term goals. The concept design is to help users maximize and coordinate efforts so that their time is not surrendered to non-essential activities. The application uses React for the front-end and Django with Python for the backend along with Django REST framework for the API.

Finding a job with G2i

"I love working with G2i because of the culture. Plus, I obtained both professional and financial growth thanks to the amazing clients they have. They really care about the entire developer experience." - Andrei Calazans

Andrei's story is proof that vacancies you see at G2i are filled with healthy and fulfilled devs - which means this could not only be your next job, but the one after that as well.

You probably want to know what's involved.

If you've been a Senior Frontend Developer for years, you already know what it takes.

It's all about delivering an amazing front-end experience. Keep your teammates happy. Keep the clients happy. All thanks to your production ready code, clear documentation, AND top notch communication skills.

You'll work 100% remotely with US clients. Take your pick from the cutting-edge of FinTech and Crypto to those in traditional Food and Beverage industries, with plenty of choices in between. And since it's a contracting position, once you finish a project you can easily move to the next one that floats your boat. We've got quite a few G2i alums who've stayed with us for several years doing just that.

Team sizes vary with each client but don't worry, you'll never be alone. We've got a really tight community of 800+ engineers on Slack that you can ask for help if you need it. You'll also have a direct line to our Developer Success Team whose job is to have your back.

Typical assignments are 32-40 hours per week, where you can bill $70-$90 per hour. If you're a stickler for detail, you might want to know that you'll be working with technologies like React, Node.js, Typescript, Apollo, Next.js and popular deployment tools.

G2i is the first hiring platform that focuses on developer health, which explains why we have plenty of opportunities for you to explore. We've seen burnout all too often in tech and we are on a mission to push back against it. We believe in maintaining a healthy work-life balance, and act on those beliefs by:
• providing a 4-day (32-hour) work week
• developing NFL-like support for burnout recovery, and
• launching the Developer Health Fund

Not to mention, we're literally writing the book on developer burnout prevention with our Restful Work OS.

Just click Apply Now . We appreciate that your resume may not be up to date so just upload a PDF of your LinkedIn profile. You can then tell us everything else we need to know in a chat with the recruiting team and a technical interview with a fellow engineer.

G2i is an equal opportunity employer. We're dedicated to building a team where diversity in both ideas and identities is not only welcomed, but encouraged. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, national origin, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Qualifications: If you've been a Senior Frontend Developer for years, you already know what it takes
If you're a stickler for detail, you might want to know that you'll be working with technologies like React, Node.js, Typescript, Apollo, Next.js and popular deployment tools
Responsibilities: The concept design is to help users maximize and coordinate efforts so that their time is not surrendered to non-essential activities
Keep the clients happy
All thanks to your production ready code, clear documentation, AND top notch communication skills

launching the Developer Health Fund

job_description:
JOB SUMMARY

Our client is looking for a Node.js/Typescript engineer to work in a small, agile team. The team creates REST and event-driven microservices that focus on using caching and reporting to improve our customers' experience. The team works at scaling, handing many millions of REST and Kafka events each day.

Engineers on this team create new microservices and improve existing microservices. Projects are usually of considerable complexity and require a mastery of development tools. Engineers are expected to design and implement scalable, dependable systems as needed. As this is a small team, engineers must be self-starters, capable of handling responsibility and making decisions.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Actively and consistently supports all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience.

Code and perform unit and integration testing of software to ensure proper and efficient execution and adherence to business and technical requirements.

Code, test, debug, and enhance software.

Write programs according to specifications, and define specifications for complex programs.

Monitor and repair critical systems on an as needed basis.

Develop and maintain technical documentation.

Serve as final escalation point to resolve incidents and problems for production applications and web services supported by the team in accordance with identified Service Level Agreements.

Collaborate with internal customers, technical and architecture teams to solve complex software problems.

Provide system users and management with system analysis and improvement recommendations.

Identify and recommend system design/requirements needs for software enhancements.

Implement, monitor, test, and audit new software programs to maximize efficiency of software systems.

Participate in continuous performance improvement sessions to discuss opportunities to improve processes and/or standards.

Coordinate with technical teams to analyze and resolve software related problems causing operational difficulties, advising on specialized features and functions.

Maximize the efficiency of the various software systems by implementing, monitoring, testing and auditing new software programs.

Follow established configuration/change control processes.

Collaborate with customers and internal/external technical teams to identify software problems and communicate remediation plans

Mentor and coach junior team members.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Technologies

Strong experience with Node.js and Typescript

Understanding of DynamoDB or other key-value stores and NoSQL databases

Experience using AWS managed services

Experience with caching architectures, particularly Redis

Strong experience with containerization and container orchestration, (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Istio, Argo, etc).

Experience with monitoring technologies (Splunk, Instana, Datadog, Prometheus, etc).

Knowledge of API documentation, especially Swagger (OpenAPI)

Experience using CI/CD automation (Jenkins, Gitlab)

Skills/Abilities and Knowledge

Ability to read, write, speak and understand English

Strong experience working with DevOps engineers to build and deploy infrastructure with cloud deployment technologies.

Strong Understanding of Scrum/Agile development methodologies.

Capable of delivering on multiple competing priorities with little supervision.

Experience with building and designing REST APIs.

Experience with building and designing event-driven systems.

Experience with software security principles and patterns.

Ability to collaborate with and contribute to a common culture of excellence.

Experience with test-driven development and automated testing frameworks.

Must be capable of delivering on multiple competing priorities with little supervision.

Qualifications: Strong experience with Node.js and Typescript
Understanding of DynamoDB or other key-value stores and NoSQL databases
Experience using AWS managed services
Experience with caching architectures, particularly Redis
Strong experience with containerization and container orchestration, (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Istio, Argo, etc)
Experience with monitoring technologies (Splunk, Instana, Datadog, Prometheus, etc)
Knowledge of API documentation, especially Swagger (OpenAPI)
Experience using CI/CD automation (Jenkins, Gitlab)
Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
Ability to read, write, speak and understand English
Strong experience working with DevOps engineers to build and deploy infrastructure with cloud deployment technologies
Strong Understanding of Scrum/Agile development methodologies
Experience with building and designing REST APIs
Experience with building and designing event-driven systems
Experience with software security principles and patterns
Ability to collaborate with and contribute to a common culture of excellence
Experience with test-driven development and automated testing frameworks
Must be capable of delivering on multiple competing priorities with little supervision

job_description:
• Summary
• We are seeking a front-end developer with experience with React and NextJS. You'll work as part of a team to deliver front-end components of our cloud database platform.
• As a Fluree front-end developer, you will implement new features and maintain existing code using React and NextJS. Your duties will include designing software solutions to meet project requirements, maintaining and refactoring existing code, writing tests, and fixing bugs.
• React Developer Essential Duties and Responsibilities
• Development of new user-facing features using React
• Build reusable components and front-end libraries for future use
• Translate designs and wireframes into high-quality code
• Communicate with team members to coordinate development efforts
• Ensure code quality and standards compliance
• React Developer Required Skills and Abilities
• Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model
• Thorough understanding of React and its core principles
• Experience with NextJS
• Familiarity with backend APIs (i.e., GraphQL)
• Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
• An understanding of common programming paradigms and fundamental React principles, such as React components, hooks, and the React lifecycle
• Experience with Typescript
• Experience with Tailwind
• Experience with cloud databases like MongoDB, Firebase, DynamoDB, etc., is a plus
• Familiarity with semantic and linked-data standards (e.g., RDF, JSON-LD) is a plus
• React Developer Education and Experience
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent work experience
• Minimum of 3 years of professional work experience

Qualifications: Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model

Experience with Typescript
Experience with Tailwind

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent work experience
Minimum of 3 years of professional work experience

job_title: Fullstack Developer (React Native, Node.js, Typescript) - Remote
job_description:
TL;DR

Our client is looking for a Fullstack engineer as they build a first-of-its-kind mobile platform that brings investing into the daily lives of its users. Their app is designed to make money more human and investing a fun part of life. They are specifically looking for developers with significant mobile (React Native) experience.

Getting a job through G2i

"G2i totally changed my life. My quality of life is way, way better. I get less stressed. I get less sick. I have more hours in my day to give attention to my family. I'm really thankful for working with them. - Tiago Souto

Tiago is proof that vacancies you see at G2i are filled with healthy and happy devs - which means this could not only be your next job, but the one after that as well.

You probably want to know what's involved.

If you've been a freelance Fullstack Developer for years, you know what it takes.

It's all about shipping an awesome product. Keep your tech lead happy. Keep the clients happy. All thanks to your production ready code, clear documentation, AND top notch communication skills.

You'll work 100% remotely with US clients. Take your pick of clients from cutting-edge FinTech and Crypto to traditional HR SaaS, with plenty of choices in between. And since it's a contracting position, once you finish a project you can easily move to the next one that floats your boat. We've got quite a few G2i alums who've stayed with us for several years doing just that.

Team sizes vary with each client but don't worry, you'll never be alone. We've got a really tight community of 800+ engineers on Slack that you can ask for help if you need it. You'll also have a direct line to our Developer Success Team whose job is to have your back.

Typical assignments are 32-40 hours per week, where you can bill up to $70 per hour. If you're a stickler for detail, you might want to know that you'll be working with technologies like React, Ruby-on-Rails, Apollo, GraphQL, Typescript and popular deployment tools.

G2i is the first hiring platform that focuses on developer health, which explains why we have plenty of opportunities for you to explore. We've seen burnout all too often in tech and we are on a mission to push back against it. We believe in maintaining a healthy work-life balance, and act on those beliefs by:
• providing a 4-day (32-hour) work week
• developing NFL-like support for burnout recovery, and
• launching the Developer Health Fund.

Not to mention, we're literally writing the book on developer burnout prevention with our Restful Work OS.

Just click Apply . We appreciate that your resume may not be up to date so just share a copy of your LinkedIn profile. You can then tell us everything else we need to know in a chat with the recruiting team and a one-off coding challenge.

G2i is an equal opportunity employer. We're dedicated to building a team where diversity in both ideas and identities is not only welcomed, but encouraged. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, national origin, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you are part of an underrepresented group in tech that is considering applying, but you have any reservations about doing so, please email our Director of Talent Acquisition, Eva@, and let us know how we can be more welcoming to you.

job_description:
We are currently seeking an experienced React Developer to join our team. The role will report directly to the company's Chief Officers for direction and management. This is a nonemployee compensation, remote position helping the company develop & architect an exciting new project. You'll be instrumental in helping define our team's foundations. Responsibilities: • DEVELOP A NEW USER-FACING APP USING REACT.JS / NEXT.JS: We’re building a new app from the ground up to fill a hole in our current market. • BUILD REUSABLE COMPONENTS AND LIBRARIES FOR FUTURE USE: We’re constantly exploring and extending the future of this space so making reusable components we can deploy quickly and efficiently is of vital importance. • TRANSLATE DESIGNS AND WIREFRAMES INTO HIGH-QUALITY CODE: Be able to work with a designer and take those designs from wireframes/UI to a fully functional dynamic application. • OPTIMIZE COMPONENTS FOR MAXIMUM PERFORMANCE ACROSS A VAST ARRAY OF WEB-CAPABLE DEVICES AND BROWSERS: This app is predominately conversion based so speed and performance across MOST modern devices are very important factors of the success of the project. • MEANINGFULLY SHAPE THE FUTURE PRODUCT: As we engage with customers, you'll gain insights to help us serve them better — and work with the product to inform what we do next. • DRIVE ADOPTION, RETENTION, AND EXPANSION FOR A PRODUCT THAT SOLVES REAL PROBLEMS: Our communities drive the heart of the company, and retaining and expanding these communities is our growth. • ELEVATE YOUR SKILLS AS WE TACKLE OUR MOST IMPACTFUL CHALLENGES: We've achieved more than teams 10x our size in less time — and there's so much more to do and learn. Qualifications: • Solid understanding of web technologies. • Passion for writing high-quality, maintainable, and robust code. • A good culture fit (passionate - reliable - straightforward). • Product Lover: you thrive on well-designed UX and always focus on customers' needs. • Hacker spirit: you love technical challenges, prototypes, and finding creative ways to solve problems. • You’re highly adaptable, and easily acclimating to a rapidly changing business and industry. • A willingness to work collaboratively. • Showing a commitment to honesty and taking responsibility for your actions is an important part of our team. Bonus Points If • You've been an early/first hire at a fast-growing start-up before. • You've got strong, confident technical ability. • You have experience using Vercel/Next.js/Supabase/Tailwind. Compensation: $80,000 - $100,000 yearly

• Develop a new user-facing app using React.js / Next.js: We’re building a new app from the ground up to fill a hole in our current market. • Build reusable components and libraries for future use: We’re constantly exploring and extending the future of this space so making reusable components we can deploy quickly and efficiently is of vital importance. • Translate designs and wireframes into high-quality code: Be able to work with a designer and take those designs from wireframes/UI to a fully functional dynamic application. • Optimize components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers: This app is predominately conversion based so speed and performance across most modern devices are very important factors of the success of the project. • Meaningfully shape the future product: As we engage with customers, you'll gain insights to help us serve them better — and work with the product to inform what we do next. • Drive adoption, retention, and expansion for a product that solves real problems: Our communities drive the heart of the company, and retaining and expanding these communities is our growth. • Elevate your skills as we tackle our most impactful challenges: We've achieved more than teams 10x our size in less time — and there's so much more to do and learn.

Qualifications: Solid understanding of web technologies
Passion for writing high-quality, maintainable, and robust code
A good culture fit (passionate - reliable - straightforward)
Product Lover: you thrive on well-designed UX and always focus on customers' needs
Hacker spirit: you love technical challenges, prototypes, and finding creative ways to solve problems
You’re highly adaptable, and easily acclimating to a rapidly changing business and industry
A willingness to work collaboratively
Showing a commitment to honesty and taking responsibility for your actions is an important part of our team
You've been an early/first hire at a fast-growing start-up before
You've got strong, confident technical ability
You have experience using Vercel/Next.js/Supabase/Tailwind
Responsibilities: You'll be instrumental in helping define our team's foundations
DEVELOP A NEW USER-FACING APP USING REACT.JS / NEXT.JS: We’re building a new app from the ground up to fill a hole in our current market

BUILD REUSABLE COMPONENTS AND LIBRARIES FOR FUTURE USE: We’re constantly exploring and extending the future of this space so making reusable components we can deploy quickly and efficiently is of vital importance
TRANSLATE DESIGNS AND WIREFRAMES INTO HIGH-QUALITY CODE: Be able to work with a designer and take those designs from wireframes/UI to a fully functional dynamic application

OPTIMIZE COMPONENTS FOR MAXIMUM PERFORMANCE ACROSS A VAST ARRAY OF WEB-CAPABLE DEVICES AND BROWSERS: This app is predominately conversion based so speed and performance across MOST modern devices are very important factors of the success of the project
MEANINGFULLY SHAPE THE FUTURE PRODUCT: As we engage with customers, you'll gain insights to help us serve them better — and work with the product to inform what we do next
DRIVE ADOPTION, RETENTION, AND EXPANSION FOR A PRODUCT THAT SOLVES REAL PROBLEMS: Our communities drive the heart of the company, and retaining and expanding these communities is our growth
ELEVATE YOUR SKILLS AS WE TACKLE OUR MOST IMPACTFUL CHALLENGES: We've achieved more than teams 10x our size in less time — and there's so much more to do and learn
Benefits: Compensation: $80,000 - $100,000 yearly

job_description:
Salary: $75,000 - 95,000

Crafting marketing leadership – one client team at a time

At Refactored, we believe in marketing’s ability to drive business results and organizational change. We also believe that a marketing agency can be a powerful accelerator for building and supporting effective internal marketing teams. By helping our clients mature their approach to marketing, they elevate their practice to a leadership position within their organization. We aim to solve today’s challenges while providing strategies and solutions that build greater capability, improve marketing’s performance, and ensure our work together has a lasting positive impact on their business.

We have the capability to deliver a broad range of marketing services to most any B2B company. We provide everything from branding and content to digital marketing and website development. However, we prefer to focus on clients who fit a specific profile, are interested in purchasing integrated solutions, and are seeking a longer-term and more impactful partnership. Today, every one of our staff members plays an active and important role in the life of our clients — each delivering their unique contribution to the success of business-critical initiatives. We serve clients by working in close partnership with their executives and SMEs. Clients trust our advice and vision, and we are the strategic center for digital programs that demand creative thinking, integrated problem solving, and ownership. If you want to take a leadership role in the development of new business opportunities to help us create innovative marketing solutions that drive bottom line results — then you’ve found your new home.

Ready to build something great?

What feels just as good as building a web project that you know is awesome? Seeing that project produce amazing results and a happy client.

Fullstack React Developer

We are looking for a talented Fullstack React Developer to join our team in Northern Colorado to help us serve a growing list of clients.

In this role, you will be working collaboratively with our technology and strategy teams to develop solutions for a full range of digital projects and marketing programs with an emphasis on quality and results for our clients.

The ideal candidate is a lifelong learner, has an eye for detail, and understands how to write reusable and efficient code following industry best practices.

Responsibilities
• Develop creative, functional, maintainable, and performance-driven web applications, websites, and components.
• Write high-quality, re-usable code following industry best practices.
• Contribute to project-based work as well as our internal library of reusable components.
• Investigate and resolve bugs or deficiencies in project codebase.
• Provide development estimates for enhancement requests.
• Complete other duties as assigned.

Competencies

In order to flourish in this roll, you will need the following:
• 2-4 years commercial experience as a Front-end Engineer
• 1-2 years of React experience, including knowledge and experience in dealing with state management
• Strong HTML and CSS (SCSS) Skills
• Good knowledge of responsive web design
• Experience with Git or other source control systems
• Excellent people skills, very client focused
• Understanding of CI/CD processes
• A creative and persistent problem-solving approach

Ideal candidate would also have:
• Some server-side language skills
• Experience with Static Site Generators (Gatsby or Next.js)
• Experience with Netlify, Vercel, or Gatsby Cloud
• Experience with GraphQL
• Experience developing sites that utilize a Headless CMS (e.g. Storyblok, Kontent, Contenful, DatoCMS, Sanity.io)

Why come work for us?

It’s amazing when you work for a company that focuses on the success of its clients and its employees simultaneously. Our clients are well matched with our culture so that we can focus on delivering quality work within a framework of mutual respect, appropriate and available budgets for the tasks at hand, and a joint understanding of how effective marketing programs should be initiated. For you, this means you’ll be a trusted advisor in the life of our clients, have strategic control over how programs develop and execute, and you’ll be a part of delivering high-impact solutions for our clients. Personally, we’ll provide you a working environment that’s flexible, enjoyable, and professionally rewarding.

We offer—
• A competitive salary and paid training
• Opportunities for professional growth through training, conferences, and continued education
• Generous vacation time
• Collaboration with passionate, seasoned professionals
• A casual, comfortable working environment
• An easy commute to our office in Windsor, Colorado
• Monthly team lunches
• Health, dental, vision and short/long term disability insurance
• 401k with 3% contribution to help you plan for your future

We're a recognized, award-winning agency and have been recognized with 36 honors for results-based programs over the years.
• 2021 Stevie Award - Marketing Campaign of the Year
• 2021 AVA Award for Digital Marketing - Integrated Marketing Campaign
• 2021 Stevie Award - Sales & Customer Service
• 2020 Fourteeners Award - Content Program Revitalization
• 2020 Fourteeners Award - Brand and Digital Launch
• 2019 Transform Awards - Best Rebrand of a Digital Property
• 2019 ITSMA Marketing Excellence Awards – Finalist: ABM Pilot Program
• 2019 B2 Awards from ANA - Search Advertising and Web Presence
• 2019 Silver Stevie Award - Marketing Solution for Sales & Customer Service
• 2018 Gold Key BMA Colorado - Best of Show for SEO, Website, ABM Program

The salary range for this position is between $75,000 and $95,000 and is based on years of experience in a similar role and education.
This is a full time position and we are not seeking 1099 contractors.

Strong HTML and CSS (SCSS) Skills
Good knowledge of responsive web design
Experience with Git or other source control systems

A creative and persistent problem-solving approach

As a Software Engineer II for the Agile Operating Model Tools, you will….

Education

job_description:
Our client is a multi-million dollar business in the Washington DC area, that is seeking to contract a full stack developer to assist with updating their website for years to come. They will likely have a few hours of work each month for the foreseeable future.

- Back-end: Django REST API

- Fluent English

- Working hours: significant overlap with 9-5 US Eastern Time

- Exceptional and thorough communication (will be working directly with the client and planning features with them)

- Extremely thorough reviewing/testing of work before sending to the client

If you’re interested, and think you might be a good fit, we’d love to hear from you. Include the phrase “C-132” at the top of your proposal, so we know you read this.

job_title: Sr. React/Node .JS Developer-100% remote & only W2
job_description:
Sr. React Developers are responsible for the development, programming, and coding of Information Technology solutions using ReactJS, Redux, D3 and NodeJS to enable Florida Blue Customer Experience applications.

Senior IT Developers are responsible for documenting detailed system specifications, participation in unit testing and maintenance of planned and unplanned internally developed applications, evaluation and performance testing of purchased products. Senior IT Developers are responsible for including IT Controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity, as well as availability of the application and data processed or output by the application. Senior IT Developers lead efforts, oversee work results, provide training and serve as a technical resource for other Developers.

GENERAL REQUIREMENTS:

• Experience with unit testing, release procedures, coding design and documentation protocol as well as change management procedures

• Proficiency using MERN and MEAN Scaffolding tools

• Demonstrated organizational, analytical and interpersonal skills

• Flexible team player

• Ability to manage tasks independently and take ownership of responsibilities

• Ability to learn from mistakes and apply constructive feedback to improve performance

• Must demonstrate initiative and effective independent decision-making skills

• Ability to communicate technical information clearly and articulately

• Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment

• In-depth understanding of the systems development life cycle

• Proficiency programming in more than one object-oriented programming language; React.Js, Node.JS, JavaScript, and HTML

o Proficiency with HTML, CSS, SASS, JavaScript/jQuery, local storage, and cross-browser compatibility are required

o May include database knowledge in MongoBD

• Experience with modern web/UI development tools and techniques: Node, Webpack, Grunt/Gulp, GIT, Axios, Jest

• Client-side templating: mustache.js, handlebars.js, panni.js, and dust.js

• Proficiency using standard desktop applications such as MS Suite and flowcharting tools such as Visio

• Proficiency using debugging tools such as; Advanced Debugger, Allinea DDT, AQtime, ARM, CA/EZTEST, etc

• Solid knowledge of DOM manipulation and client-side validation

• Solid knowledge with jQuery and other JavaScript libraries

• High critical thinking skills to evaluate alternatives and present solutions that are consistent with business objectives and strategy

• Experience with responsive grid systems

• Solid knowledge of React and Redux principals and build out

The preferred qualifications listed below reflect desired knowledge, skill, and/or experience.

Additional Preferred Qualifications:

• Various Domain experience; Health Care, Financial, etc

• Experience using Agile, Waterfall, or hybrid methodology

• Experience with mobile design (native and mobile web) a plus

• Experience with Foundation a plus

• Experience with web accessibility guidelines and requirements a plus

5-8 years of IT development/programming/coding professional work experience

Bachelor’s Degree in IT related field or relevant work experience

job_description:
Full Stack React Developer

The Challenge:

Are you looking for an opportunity to not just develop sof tware, but to build a system that will modernize federal healthcare?As a Full-Stack React Developer, you can solve a problem with a complete end-to-end solution in a fast-paced, Agile environment. We’re looking for a developer with the advanced skills needed to build transformative applications from vision to production-ready system. This role is more than just coding, we need a full-stack developer who will use their passion to learn new tools and te chn iques, identify and implement system improvements, and mentor teammates. On our team, you’ll help customers overcome their most difficult challenges using the latest architectural approaches like microservices, domain driven design, and n-tier. Using React and Java te chn ologies and Agile lifecycle development, you’ll build and sustain vital applications for the Veterans Administration. You’ll analyze the needs and the environment to make sure the solution you’re developing considers the architecture and operating environment, as well as future functionality and enhancements.

Work with us as we build systems to change Veterans Affairs for the better.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:
• 5+ years of experience as a React S of tware Developer or S of tware Engineer
• 5+ years of experience with ReactJS, including React JSP
• 3+ years of experience with Linux, Java, JavaScript, Java Beans, JMS, J2EE, Spring, Hibernate, CSS, DHTML, HTML, or XML
• Experience with using JIRA and Confluence
• Experience with CI / CD tools, including DevOps
• Knowledge of sof tware development and user interface web applications
• Ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust or Suitability/Fitness determination based on client requirements
• Bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics

Nice If You Have:
• Experience in the Federal Government, Veterans Affairs, or Healthcare IT sectors
• Knowledge of architecture styles and APIs, including SOAP, REST, or RPC
• Knowledge of HyperScience
• Knowledge of 508 compliance requirements
• Knowledge of Agile frameworks
• SAFe certification

Vetting:

Applicants selected will be subject to a government investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements of the U.S. government client.

Build Your Career:

Consulting at Booz Allen means empowering you to provide your customers with the best support. With a consulting career at Booz Allen, you’ll have access to:
• a large business consulting community
• experts in virtually every field
• a culture that focuses on supporting our employees

We have opportunities that provide stability while offering variety, so you can find the right fit for your career — and your life. You’ll also have access to a wealth of training resources through our Consulting University, an online learning portal where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical, certifications, and books. Build your skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site courses, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success. With contracts across the globe in multiple industries, no matter where you want to go with your consulting career, we have the path the takes you there.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $81,800.00 to $186,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.

Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
• If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
• If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

EEO Commitment

We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.
